title: Migration to a new computer
content:
I wish to move my Thunderbird and lightning application, including all filters and old emails, to a new computer. In the old versions that I used to use, this was as easy as copy and paste, but that seems to not be the case with version 140, so I have to bother you with a request for help.

I am running LinuxMint Mate 22.2.

I followed the directions in one of your articles and found myself at the Troubleshooting page, Profile Directory entry. I clicked the Open Directory button next to it as instructed, but nothing happens. So, since your instructions said that that action would just take me to a .Thunderbird directory anyway, I attempted to search for that with hidden files turned off. But no joy their, either.

Can you let me in on a secret, like what is the path is to this hidden folder, rather than having me use your mystery button? Then I can just move the files myself, if that is indeed the solution.

Thank you for your assistance.

title: At launch, very random times maybe, Thunderbird will hang......
content:
Hi

I am using the latest TB build, 144.0.1and have only the British dictionary as an extension, no themes.

Occasionally TB will hang when launched and the Windows event viewer will show this....(added image)_

The friendly xml log within the event viewer...


AppName thunderbird.exe 

 AppVersion 144.0.1.0   ProcessId 0x6234   StartTime 0x1dc51956edcf231   TerminationTime 5   ExeFileName C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe   ReportId f3ad169f-c629-4357-85ae-7db29d0541f1   PackageFullName    PackageRelativeAppId

HangType Cross-process

as noted, this only happens when the email client is launched and will not happen each time. I have tried without the dictionary, as it is so random it can take a while to occur, but that does not seem to make a difference.

I am using Windows 11 25h2

Thanks

title: How to stop Thunderbird from mangling plain text emails that I compose?
content:
When I compose email messages, I want them to be plain text only. In older versions of Thunderbird, this worked fairly well, but in new versions, even though the message is sent as plain text, it is not the same text that I type into the editor.

For example, if I begin a line with "> " (greater-than space) to indicate a quotation, Thunderbird will add another space at the beginning. I once tried to send "-- " (dash dash space, a signature marker) in a message, only to find that Thunderbird replaced the space with a non-breaking space.

I didn't ask for that. I want the content of the message that I send be exactly what I type, nothing more, nothing less. No reflowing, no subtle character alternation. Is there a setting to disable those mis-features?
creator: abacabadabacaba
